description: Calculate the predicted stellar velocity dispersion from a lens mass model.
instructions: Create a lens model using a power-law elliptical mass distribution (Einstein radius = 1.0 arcsec, power-law slope gamma = 2.1, axis ratio = 0.75, position angle = 30 degrees). For the lens light, use a Sérsic profile centered at the lens position (effective radius = 0.8 arcsec, Sérsic index = 4, axis ratio = 0.8, position angle = 30 degrees). Using lenstronomy's kinematic module, calculate the luminosity-weighted line-of-sight velocity dispersion within an aperture of 1.0 arcsec diameter, assuming an anisotropy parameter beta = 0, lens redshift z_lens = 0.5, source redshift z_source = 2.0, and standard ΛCDM cosmology (H0 = 70 km/s/Mpc, Ωm = 0.3, ΩΛ = 0.7). Report the velocity dispersion in km/s.
